I visited @GwinnettTech to speak on my continued commitment to boosting workforce development in our community.

This includes my WORC Act that will reduce recidivism & address the current workforce gap by helping incarcerated individuals find stable employment in skilled trades. https://t.co/5BMT668whg

Experts have made it clear that successful reentry into society after incarceration relies on stable employment.

My newly introduced bill utilizes @USDOL grants to develop America's workforce while reducing barriers facing individuals attempting to re-enter the labor market. https://t.co/ouzYqBOyGH

Glad to bring together Police Chiefs from @GwinnettPd and @ForsythOf today for a roundtable discussion. Our ongoing communication is crucial to prioritizing the safety of every member of our community. https://t.co/djG1b6fFkW

The US and our allies must stand united against President Putin's misinformation and military aggression in Ukraine. We must forcefully respond to Russia's belligerence and send a clear message to Putin and all other autocrats.

Hopped on @gctransit's Route 10B-3 with some awesome passengers & staff!

From Sugarloaf to Doraville, thousands rely on these routes everyday, but we need more of this in Gwinnett! I am proud to deliver Infrastructure Law funds & expand transit access with more routes & buses. https://t.co/QYpaXEY0JT

Thank you @EastsideChamber for our productive meeting today!

It was great to hear updates from the local business community and share more on my work in Congress to continue connecting businesses with federal assistance. https://t.co/3HGAzjqSkn

Tomorrow marks two years since Ahmaud Arbery's life was stolen.

Today his murderers were found guilty of killing Ahmaud because of the color of his skin. We must never forget, Ahmaud's murder was nothing short of a lynching.

Mark your calendars for my #CoffeeWithCarolyn this weekend!‚òï 

My team and I want to hear from you & help in any way we can. Join us Saturday, Feb. 26 at 2 PM to share your thoughts, opinions, and concerns.

I'd like to recognize Marlene Fosque who is the first African American person to be elected to the Gwinnett County Board of Commissioners and still serves the community in this role. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/22i3npth2a

Friendly reminder that for today on Presidents Day businesses, public schools, & government buildings have varying hours and many are closed.

Check out some online resources to see what's open around you in the Atlanta region.
https://t.co/74EIMcSA8t

On this #DayofRemembrance, we reflect on the shameful and discriminatory 1942 Executive order that targeted Japanese Americans, forcing nearly 120,000 people to leave their homes and be placed in internment camps.

We educate ourselves on injustice to not repeat mistakes.

Today we gathered to remember the lives taken & displaced by violent white supremacist mobs in 1912 Forsyth Co.

I thank Pastor Headd, Deacon Green, Judge Harris & all who shared how this conflict impacted our community for decades. Let us keep moving forward together. https://t.co/lPfEx1wBaw

I am humbled and grateful to the descendants of Forsyth County's 1912 racial cleansing who shared their stories today at Poplar Hill Baptist Church.

We must keep listening and retelling our history in its entirety to move toward justice and reconciliation in our communities. https://t.co/0zfMGnCCY6

To all our local veterans ‚Äì I hear you.

I'd like to recognize Nicole Love Hendrickson. Making history in our #GA07 community, she is the first Black woman to be elected chairwoman of the Gwinnett County Board of Commissioners. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/oaJ59rdIOq

Efforts like this help us move toward justice and reconciliation in our community.
https://t.co/1Jl0mQoaDB
How it started                          How it's going! https://t.co/hoR6TI9r76

This is an unacceptable one-party overhaul of local redistricting.
https://t.co/tc88ATSldo

Four years ago 17 lives were stolen by a mass shooter at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School. My heart is with the victim's families today and everyday.

To honor of the students, teachers, and staff lost that day, I fight for #GunReformNow in Congress.

However you are spending this Valentine's Day, I hope it is filled with much love and joy!

If you're looking for a way to spread the caring spirit today, consider researching and spreading awareness for #NationalDonorDay! Choosing to be a donor is a life-saving act of kindness.

I'd like to recognize Stacey Abrams, a steadfast Georgian leader & the first African American woman nominated to run for governor by a major party in any state.

She has already left a long-lasting & inspirational impact on Georgia, voting rights, & the nation. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/L6CoJ7Uc0g

It's Georgia Day, marking 289 years since English settlers landed at Savannah.

This day should encourage us to learn about our region's history before this date, its diverse history after, and to look ahead to all the progress we can achieve to make Georgia better for all.

On this day in 1909 the @NAACP was founded. For over 110 years, they have been on the frontlines of the fight for civil rights, changing lives and this country forever.

We must remain attentive and active supporters in their mission to end civil injustice in the United States.
One of my favorite parts of my job is speaking with our talented young people. Loved the chance to speak with the Snellville Youth Commission today! https://t.co/4PDnXnHHYR

Enjoyed another productive meeting with the @GwinnettChamber today!

üìàOur economy created 467,000 jobs in January and 6.6 million jobs since the Biden-Harris administration took office! 

These historic strides are building our economy back even stronger than before.

Accessing federal relief like the #CTC can be life-changing. My office ensures our #GA07 communities can access the full amount of federal assistance they are eligible for.

My team helped Nicole P. when she hit roadblocks receiving her Child Tax Cut payments! https://t.co/sZsjfSCrBi

In 1912, a white supremacist mob drove out nearly the entire Black population of Forsyth County, GA. I am offering a resolution to honor all the lives lost and call for a national day of remembrance for all victims of forced migrations of Black Americans in our nation's history. https://t.co/K7AErNJmYb
Today I proudly stood with many of my House colleagues for LGBTQ rights around the world and passed the Global Respect Act.

With this resolution, the 1912 racial cleansing will be acknowledged and the victims honored by the US House. This is a step forward, toward justice and reconciliation for our North Georgia community.

This violence was not an isolated incident. We must elevate that truth.

3/3

The lynchings and violence have been mostly lost in Forsyth County's history, and as we celebrate Black History Month, we must reaffirm our commitment to fight white supremacy and right the wrongs of our past. 

2/3

I introduced a resolution today to recognize the 1,100 Black Americans terrorized and driven from their homes in 1912, in Forsyth County.

It is long past time those displaced, lost, and their descendants had their truth heard in the halls of Congress. 

1/3 https://t.co/s8d9sFAu68

I'd like to recognize Beauty Baldwin, a trailblazing leader and role model for Georgia's students, teachers, and schools.

Appointed Superintendent of Buford City Schools in 1984, she is the first Black female school superintendent in Georgia. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/R6f6TzOy04
As a professor, I'm usually giving the grades, not receiving them. I am very proud to have received a 100% score on my congressional voting record from the @civilrightsorg!

I helped pass the bipartisan Postal Service Reform Act because Georgians need a reliable Postal Service for generations to come. 

From receiving bills to medicine, this bill supports our communities, postal workers, and USPS financial stability as they serve the American people.

On #SaferInternetDay, I join @RepSusanWild in asking social media companies be considerate of their everyday influence on children's lives and mental health.

To foster a safer internet for our children, we must respect how easily online content can become dangerous off-screen. https://t.co/rPWWRopQVR
Happy to co-sponsor this important legislation to support well-rounded veteran health care access. https://t.co/eHBpt2k4TG

I'm wishing my husband Jeff a very happy birthday today!

Thank you for being a wonderful husband and father.

I am proud to join colleagues from both sides of the aisle today and vote to allow sexual assault and harassment survivors to seek justice in court.

It‚Äôs time to #EndForcedArbitration for victims of sexual assault! https://t.co/0DSpRJYwDk

In Georgia and across the country, minority populations bear the heaviest burden of the HIV/AIDS epidemic. 

Together on #NBHAAD and everyday, we can reject the stigma surrounding HIV and AIDS and promote access to testing and treatment to save lives.

I'd like to recognize @AmbAndrewYoung for his leadership in the civil rights movement and years of leadership for Georgia in Congress and as the 55th Mayor of Atlanta. His dedicated activism improves upon the lives of so many in this nation and our state. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/319f7g8a1O

Her pioneering leadership paved the way for generations to follow. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/LWE86wChMZ

Last month, I wrote to @SecBecerra on behalf of the 61.5 million Americans enrolled in Medicare who were left out of full access to free COVID-19 tests.

Starting early spring, these Americans will also be covered for up to 8 tests per month and be better protected from COVID-19! https://t.co/fsIGDpMDMl

üö®My Supply CHAIN Act has passed in the House with the America COMPETES Act!

This legislation directly works to alleviate our supply chain crisis by mapping and monitoring supply chains for critical goods and services.
Passing the infrastructure law was a huge step, but it won't be our last in ensuring transit is affordable, accessible, & safe in every corner of our communities! #TransitEquityDay

I am proud that the America COMPETES Act includes  crucial proposals led by myself and our GA Senators.

With investments in supply chains, regional technology hubs, & manufacturing, this bill is transformative for GA job growth & 21st-century economy.
https://t.co/AAaOdV2RJO

Happy birthday to Rosa Parks, one of our greatest American role models and activists.

We honor her legacy in our continued fight for equality, and justice.

I introduced my Supply CHAIN Act after hearing from small businesses, families, & manufacturers hurt by supply chain disruptions.

Let's end the supply chain crisis, safeguard Americans' economic future, & pass the America COMPETES Act. Watch my full remarks on the House floor ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/PdYZXDlsce

ICYMI: I joined in introducing the bipartisan Medical and Health Stockpile Accountability Act. 

COVID-19 highlighted how vital it is to understand health supply chains. This bill establishes a data system to find shortages before they can become dangerous to patient care.

Across the nation and in GA today, we are facing some of the largest attacks on #AbortionAccess in history. We must protect reproductive health care access and the Senate must follow the House's lead and pass #WHPA!

In 2010, the #CitizensUnited decision altered how political campaigns operated. Since then, we have seen more dark money in politics & less transparency.

Our election system needs Congress to take action, strengthen campaign finance laws, & overturn the Citizens United decision.
.@SenOssoff‚Äôs speech emphasizes Georgians‚Äô frustrations with being told empty platitudes on their right to vote but watching those same leaders fail #VotingRightsNow. https://t.co/LXvSMOVxrr

Fighting for #VotingRightsNow is to be their voice & ensure our laws protect their FREEDOM to vote. https://t.co/nFGOdkaex9

We've all been through a lot since the U.S. confirmed its first COVID-19 case two years ago.

Our nation's path forward remains the same ‚Äì #GetVaccinated and #Boosted so we can keep our loved ones safe and our communities, schools, businesses, and lives open.

I was proud to help pass the EVEST Act today, which gives our veterans immediate access to the health care they need and deserve.
 
From mental health services to routine check-ups, the bill's automatic enrollment eases veterans' transition into civilian life.

Today, a majority in the U.S. Senate turned their backs on the voters of Georgia who have been purged from voter registration rolls, had their absentee ballots thrown out, and sometimes waited in line to vote up to 12 hours. 
 
But we will not give up. We will find a way through.

I went to the Senate Floor to listen to the debate as my Senate colleagues work to pass voting rights protections for all Americans. We must defend the right to vote. I urge the Senate‚Äîend the filibuster and protect the vote! #FreedomToVoteAct https://t.co/DM0Fzqe6pO

Don‚Äôt talk to Georgia Dems about making sure voting rights reform is bipartisan. GA's GOP didn‚Äôt worry about bipartisanship when passing bills to shut down vote by mail & allow partisan takeover of local boards of elections. Not. One. Bit. 

The Senate must pass #VotingRightsNow.

The GA GOP responded to Trump's 2020 loss by making it harder to vote, particularly for working people in urban/suburban areas & people of color.

They based their voter suppression bill in a lie about GA's election results despite their own investigations finding nothing wrong.

Today, I call on the US Senate to stand up for the voters of Georgia - & the voters of this country.

GA voters have faced:
‚û°Ô∏èpurges from voter reg. rolls 
‚û°Ô∏èthrown out absentee ballots &
